title: Jesus' Strange Lack of "Prophetic" Political Call-Outs
description:
John the Baptist denounces Herod Antipas for marrying his brother's wife and it costs John his head. Why didn't Jesus denounce Herod or Tiberius Caesar for his bloodthirsty corruption or pedophilia? John's behavior was in line with Old Testament prophets like Elijah calling out Ahab and Jezebel but Jesus doesn't seem to do this. This clearly didn't earn Jesus any points with certain factions of 1st Century culture warriors. What was Jesus doing? 

(For more on the sex habits of the early Caesars see https://www.patheos.com/blogs/catholicauthenticity/2015/07/the-gay-roman-emperor-gene/) 
Click here to meetup with other channel viewers for conversation https://discord.gg/2uUhZBK The link will prompt you to download the software for this free group messaging service. This link updates every 100 users so look for the most recent videos if this link doesn't work.

If you want to schedule a one-on-one conversation check here. https://paulvanderklay.me/2019/08/06/converzations-with-pvk/

For the audio podcast mirror on Podbean http://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/

To listen to this on ITunes https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/paul-vanderklays-podcast/id1394314333 

If you need the RSS feed for your podcast player https://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/feed/
